channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024100216
item.description:
Report X-2024100216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LEAKING PACAGE WITH HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL WAS FOUND OUTSIDE DOOR 16 IN THE UNLOAD ON THE PRELOAD SORT. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA AND PROCESSED USING ZEP ZORBENT WHILE WEARING GOGGLES, GLOVES, APRON BOOTS.

item.title: Report E-2024100051
item.description:
Report E-2024100051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide solution was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 30-gallon drums and staged onsite for transport and disposal.
